63
64/*
65 * Prescan command line for [-U user] argument
66 * and fill context with defaults
67 */
68int
69smb_ctx_init(struct smb_ctx *ctx, int argc, char *argv[],
70 int minlevel, int maxlevel, int sharetype)
71{
72 int opt, error = 0;
73 uid_t euid;
74 const char *arg, *cp;
75 struct passwd *pwd;
76
77 bzero(ctx,sizeof(*ctx));
78 error = nb_ctx_create(&ctx->ct_nb);
79 if (error)
80 return error;
81 ctx->ct_fd = -1;
82 ctx->ct_parsedlevel = SMBL_NONE;
83 ctx->ct_minlevel = minlevel;
84 ctx->ct_maxlevel = maxlevel;
85
86 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_opt = SMBVOPT_CREATE;
87 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_timeout = 15;
88 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_retrycount = 4;
89 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_owner = SMBM_ANY_OWNER;
90 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_group = SMBM_ANY_GROUP;
91 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_mode = SMBM_EXEC;
92 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_rights = SMBM_DEFAULT;
93
94 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_opt = SMBVOPT_CREATE;
95 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_owner = SMBM_ANY_OWNER;
96 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_group = SMBM_ANY_GROUP;
97 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_mode = SMBM_EXEC;
98 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_rights = SMBM_DEFAULT;
99 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_owner = SMBM_ANY_OWNER;
100 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_group = SMBM_ANY_GROUP;
101
102 nb_ctx_setscope(ctx->ct_nb, "");
103 euid = geteuid();
104 if ((pwd = getpwuid(euid)) != NULL) {
105 smb_ctx_setuser(ctx, pwd->pw_name);
106 endpwent();
107 } else if (euid == 0)
108 smb_ctx_setuser(ctx, "root");
109 else
110 return 0;
111 if (argv == NULL)
112 return 0;
113 for (opt = 1; opt < argc; opt++) {
114 cp = argv[opt];
115 if (strncmp(cp, "//", 2) != 0)
116 continue;
117 error = smb_ctx_parseunc(ctx, cp, sharetype, (const char**)&cp);
118 if (error)
119 return error;
120 ctx->ct_uncnext = cp;
121 break;
122 }
123 while (error == 0 && (opt = cf_getopt(argc, argv, ":E:L:U:")) != -1) {
124 arg = cf_optarg;
125 switch (opt) {
126 case 'E':
127 error = smb_ctx_setcharset(ctx, arg);
128 if (error)
129 return error;
130 break;
131 case 'L':
132 error = nls_setlocale(optarg);
133 if (error)
134 break;
135 break;
136 case 'U':
137 error = smb_ctx_setuser(ctx, arg);
138 break;
139 }
140 }
141 cf_optind = cf_optreset = 1;
142 return error;
143}
144
145void
146smb_ctx_done(struct smb_ctx *ctx)
147{
148 if (ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_server)
149 nb_snbfree(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_server);
150 if (ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_local)
151 nb_snbfree(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_local);
152 if (ctx->ct_srvaddr)
153 free(ctx->ct_srvaddr);
154 if (ctx->ct_nb)
155 nb_ctx_done(ctx->ct_nb);
156}
157
158static int
159getsubstring(const char *p, u_char sep, char *dest, int maxlen, const char **next)
160{
161 int len;
162
163 maxlen--;
164 for (len = 0; len < maxlen && *p != sep; p++, len++, dest++) {
165 if (*p == 0)
166 return EINVAL;
167 *dest = *p;
168 }
169 *dest = 0;
170 *next = *p ? p + 1 : p;
171 return 0;
172}
173
174/*
175 * Here we expect something like "[proto:]//[user@]host[/share][/path]"
176 */
177int
178smb_ctx_parseunc(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *unc, int sharetype,
179 const char **next)
180{
181 const char *p = unc;
182 char *p1;
183 char tmp[1024];
184 int error ;
185
186 ctx->ct_parsedlevel = SMBL_NONE;
187 if (*p++ != '/' || *p++ != '/') {
188 smb_error("UNC should start with '//'", 0);
189 return EINVAL;
190 }
191 p1 = tmp;
192 error = getsubstring(p, '@', p1, sizeof(tmp), &p);
193 if (!error) {
194 if (ctx->ct_maxlevel < SMBL_VC) {
195 smb_error("no user name required", 0);
196 return EINVAL;
197 }
198 if (*p1 == 0) {
199 smb_error("empty user name", 0);
200 return EINVAL;
201 }
202 error = smb_ctx_setuser(ctx, tmp);
203 if (error)
204 return error;
205 ctx->ct_parsedlevel = SMBL_VC;
206 }
207 error = getsubstring(p, '/', p1, sizeof(tmp), &p);
208 if (error) {
209 error = getsubstring(p, '\0', p1, sizeof(tmp), &p);
210 if (error) {
211 smb_error("no server name found", 0);
212 return error;
213 }
214 }
215 if (*p1 == 0) {
216 smb_error("empty server name", 0);
217 return EINVAL;
218 }
219 error = smb_ctx_setserver(ctx, tmp);
220 if (error)
221 return error;
222 if (sharetype == SMB_ST_NONE) {
223 *next = p;
224 return 0;
225 }
226 if (*p != 0 && ctx->ct_maxlevel < SMBL_SHARE) {
227 smb_error("no share name required", 0);
228 return EINVAL;
229 }
230 error = getsubstring(p, '/', p1, sizeof(tmp), &p);
231 if (error) {
232 error = getsubstring(p, '\0', p1, sizeof(tmp), &p);
233 if (error) {
234 smb_error("unexpected end of line", 0);
235 return error;
236 }
237 }
238 if (*p1 == 0 && ctx->ct_minlevel >= SMBL_SHARE) {
239 smb_error("empty share name", 0);
240 return EINVAL;
241 }
242 *next = p;
243 if (*p1 == 0)
244 return 0;
245 error = smb_ctx_setshare(ctx, p1, sharetype);
246 return error;
247}
248
249int
250smb_ctx_setcharset(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *arg)
251{
252 char *cp, *servercs, *localcs;
253 int cslen = sizeof(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_localcs);
254 int scslen, lcslen, error;
255
256 cp = strchr(arg, ':');
257 lcslen = cp ? (cp - arg) : 0;
258 if (lcslen == 0 || lcslen >= cslen) {
259 smb_error("invalid local charset specification (%s)", 0, arg);
260 return EINVAL;
261 }
262 scslen = (size_t)strlen(++cp);
263 if (scslen == 0 || scslen >= cslen) {
264 smb_error("invalid server charset specification (%s)", 0, arg);
265 return EINVAL;
266 }
267 localcs = memcpy(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_localcs, arg, lcslen);
268 localcs[lcslen] = 0;
269 servercs = strcpy(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_servercs, cp);
270 error = nls_setrecode(localcs, servercs);
271 if (error == 0)
272 return 0;
273 smb_error("can't initialize iconv support (%s:%s)",
274 error, localcs, servercs);
275 localcs[0] = 0;
276 servercs[0] = 0;
277 return error;
278}
279
280int
281smb_ctx_setserver(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *name)
282{
283 char *d;
284
285 /*
286 * If the name contains dot, it's likely a IP address
287 * or a name. Update srvaddr in that case, and use
288 * first part of the name (up to the dot) as NetBIOS name.
289 */
290 if ((d = strchr(name, '.'))) {
291 static char nm[sizeof(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname)];
292 int error;
293
294 error = smb_ctx_setsrvaddr(ctx, name);
295 if (error)
296 return (error);
297
298 /* cut name to MAXSRVNAMELEN */
299 if (strlen(name) >= sizeof(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname)) {
300 snprintf(nm, sizeof(nm), "%.*s",
301 (int)(sizeof(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname) - 1), name);
302 name = nm;
303 }
304 }
305
306 if (strlen(name) >= sizeof(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname)) {
307 smb_error("server name '%s' too long", 0, name);
308 return ENAMETOOLONG;
309 }
310 nls_str_upper(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname, name);
311 return 0;
312}
313
314int
315smb_ctx_setuser(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *name)
316{
317 if (strlen(name) >= sizeof(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_user)) {
318 smb_error("user name '%s' too long", 0, name);
319 return ENAMETOOLONG;
320 }
321 nls_str_upper(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_user, name);
322 return 0;
323}
324
325int
326smb_ctx_setworkgroup(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *name)
327{
328 if (strlen(name) >= SMB_MAXUSERNAMELEN) {
329 smb_error("workgroup name '%s' too long", 0, name);
330 return ENAMETOOLONG;
331 }
332 nls_str_upper(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_workgroup, name);
333 return 0;
334}
335
336int
337smb_ctx_setpassword(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *passwd)
338{
339 if (passwd == NULL)
340 return EINVAL;
341 if (strlen(passwd) >= SMB_MAXPASSWORDLEN) {
342 smb_error("password too long", 0);
343 return ENAMETOOLONG;
344 }
345 if (strncmp(passwd, "$$1", 3) == 0)
346 smb_simpledecrypt(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_password, passwd);
347 else
348 strcpy(ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_password, passwd);
349 strcpy(ctx->ct_sh.ioc_password, ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_password);
350 return 0;
351}
352
353int
354smb_ctx_setshare(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *share, int stype)
355{
356 if (strlen(share) >= SMB_MAXSHARENAMELEN) {
357 smb_error("share name '%s' too long", 0, share);
358 return ENAMETOOLONG;
359 }
360 nls_str_upper(ctx->ct_sh.ioc_share, share);
361 if (share[0] != 0)
362 ctx->ct_parsedlevel = SMBL_SHARE;
363 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_stype = stype;
364 return 0;
365}
366
367int
368smb_ctx_setsrvaddr(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *addr)
369{
370 if (addr == NULL || addr[0] == 0)
371 return EINVAL;
372 if (ctx->ct_srvaddr)
373 free(ctx->ct_srvaddr);
374 if ((ctx->ct_srvaddr = strdup(addr)) == NULL)
375 return ENOMEM;
376 return 0;
377}
378
379static int
380smb_parse_owner(char *pair, uid_t *uid, gid_t *gid)
381{
382 struct group *gr;
383 struct passwd *pw;
384 char *cp;
385
386 cp = strchr(pair, ':');
387 if (cp) {
388 *cp++ = '\0';
389 if (*cp) {
390 gr = getgrnam(cp);
391 if (gr) {
392 *gid = gr->gr_gid;
393 } else
394 smb_error("Invalid group name '%s', ignored",
395 0, cp);
396 }
397 }
398 if (*pair) {
399 pw = getpwnam(pair);
400 if (pw) {
401 *uid = pw->pw_uid;
402 } else
403 smb_error("Invalid user name '%s', ignored", 0, pair);
404 }
405 endpwent();
406 return 0;
407}
408
409int
410smb_ctx_opt(struct smb_ctx *ctx, int opt, const char *arg)
411{
412 int error = 0;
413 char *p, *cp;
414
415 switch(opt) {
416 case 'U':
417 break;
418 case 'I':
419 error = smb_ctx_setsrvaddr(ctx, arg);
420 break;
421 case 'M':
422 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_rights = strtol(arg, &cp, 8);
423 if (*cp == '/') {
424 ctx->ct_sh.ioc_rights = strtol(cp + 1, &cp, 8);
425 ctx->ct_flags |= SMBCF_SRIGHTS;
426 }
427 break;
428 case 'N':
429 ctx->ct_flags |= SMBCF_NOPWD;
430 break;
431 case 'O':
432 p = strdup(arg);
433 cp = strchr(p, '/');
434 if (cp) {
435 *cp++ = '\0';
436 error = smb_parse_owner(cp, &ctx->ct_sh.ioc_owner,
437 &ctx->ct_sh.ioc_group);
438 }
439 if (*p && error == 0) {
440 error = smb_parse_owner(p, &ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_owner,
441 &ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_group);
442 }
443 free(p);
444 break;
445 case 'P':
446/* ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_opt |= SMBCOPT_PERMANENT;*/
447 break;
448 case 'R':
449 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_retrycount = atoi(arg);
450 break;
451 case 'T':
452 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_timeout = atoi(arg);
453 break;
454 case 'W':
455 error = smb_ctx_setworkgroup(ctx, arg);
456 break;
457 }
458 return error;
459}
460
461#if 0
462static void
463smb_hexdump(const u_char *buf, int len) {
464 int ofs = 0;
465
466 while (len--) {
467 if (ofs % 16 == 0)
468 printf("\n%02X: ", ofs);
469 printf("%02x ", *buf++);
470 ofs++;
471 }
472 printf("\n");
473}
474#endif
475
476
477static int
478smb_addiconvtbl(const char *to, const char *from, const u_char *tbl)
479{
480 int error;
481
482 error = kiconv_add_xlat_table(to, from, tbl);
483 if (error && error != EEXIST) {
484 smb_error("can not setup kernel iconv table (%s:%s)", error,
485 from, to);
486 return error;
487 }
488 return 0;
489}
490
491/*
492 * Verify context before connect operation(s),
493 * lookup specified server and try to fill all forgotten fields.
494 */
495int
496smb_ctx_resolve(struct smb_ctx *ctx)
497{
498 struct smbioc_ossn *ssn = &ctx->ct_ssn;
499 struct smbioc_oshare *sh = &ctx->ct_sh;
500 struct nb_name nn;
501 struct sockaddr *sap;
502 struct sockaddr_nb *salocal, *saserver;
503 char *cp;
504#ifdef notyet
505 u_char cstbl[256];
506 u_int i;
507#endif
508 int error = 0;
509
510 ctx->ct_flags &= ~SMBCF_RESOLVED;
511 if (ssn->ioc_srvname[0] == 0) {
512 smb_error("no server name specified", 0);
513 return EINVAL;
514 }
515 if (ssn->ioc_user[0] == 0) {
516 smb_error("no user name specified for server %s",
517 0, ssn->ioc_srvname);
518 return EINVAL;
519 }
520 if (ctx->ct_minlevel >= SMBL_SHARE && sh->ioc_share[0] == 0) {
521 smb_error("no share name specified for %s@%s",
522 0, ssn->ioc_user, ssn->ioc_srvname);
523 return EINVAL;
524 }
525 error = nb_ctx_resolve(ctx->ct_nb);
526 if (error)
527 return error;
528 if (ssn->ioc_localcs[0] == 0)
529 strcpy(ssn->ioc_localcs, "default"); /* XXX: locale name ? */
530 error = smb_addiconvtbl("tolower", ssn->ioc_localcs, nls_lower);
531 if (error)
532 return error;
533 error = smb_addiconvtbl("toupper", ssn->ioc_localcs, nls_upper);
534 if (error)
535 return error;
536#ifdef notyet
537 if (ssn->ioc_servercs[0] != 0) {
538 for(i = 0; i < sizeof(cstbl); i++)
539 cstbl[i] = i;
540 nls_mem_toext(cstbl, cstbl, sizeof(cstbl));
541 error = smb_addiconvtbl(ssn->ioc_servercs, ssn->ioc_localcs, cstbl);
542 if (error)
543 return error;
544 for(i = 0; i < sizeof(cstbl); i++)
545 cstbl[i] = i;
546 nls_mem_toloc(cstbl, cstbl, sizeof(cstbl));
547 error = smb_addiconvtbl(ssn->ioc_localcs, ssn->ioc_servercs, cstbl);
548 if (error)
549 return error;
550 }
551#endif
552 if (ctx->ct_srvaddr) {
553 error = nb_resolvehost_in(ctx->ct_srvaddr, &sap);
554 } else {
555 error = nbns_resolvename(ssn->ioc_srvname, ctx->ct_nb, &sap);
556 }
557 if (error) {
558 smb_error("can't get server address", error);
559 return error;
560 }
561 nn.nn_scope = ctx->ct_nb->nb_scope;
562 nn.nn_type = NBT_SERVER;
563 strcpy(nn.nn_name, ssn->ioc_srvname);
564 error = nb_sockaddr(sap, &nn, &saserver);
565 nb_snbfree(sap);
566 if (error) {
567 smb_error("can't allocate server address", error);
568 return error;
569 }
570 ssn->ioc_server = (struct sockaddr*)saserver;
571 if (ctx->ct_locname[0] == 0) {
572 error = nb_getlocalname(ctx->ct_locname);
573 if (error) {
574 smb_error("can't get local name", error);
575 return error;
576 }
577 nls_str_upper(ctx->ct_locname, ctx->ct_locname);
578 }
579 strcpy(nn.nn_name, ctx->ct_locname);
580 nn.nn_type = NBT_WKSTA;
581 nn.nn_scope = ctx->ct_nb->nb_scope;
582 error = nb_sockaddr(NULL, &nn, &salocal);
583 if (error) {
584 nb_snbfree((struct sockaddr*)saserver);
585 smb_error("can't allocate local address", error);
586 return error;
587 }
588 ssn->ioc_local = (struct sockaddr*)salocal;
589 ssn->ioc_lolen = salocal->snb_len;
590 ssn->ioc_svlen = saserver->snb_len;
591 if (ssn->ioc_password[0] == 0 && (ctx->ct_flags & SMBCF_NOPWD) == 0) {
592 cp = getpass("Password:");
593 error = smb_ctx_setpassword(ctx, cp);
594 if (error)
595 return error;
596 }
597 ctx->ct_flags |= SMBCF_RESOLVED;
598 return 0;
599}
600
601static int
602smb_ctx_gethandle(struct smb_ctx *ctx)
603{
604 int fd, i;
605 char buf[20];
606
607 /*
608 * First, try to open as cloned device
609 */
610 fd = smb_kops.ko_open("/dev/"NSMB_NAME, O_RDWR, 0);
611 if (fd >= 0) {
612 ctx->ct_fd = fd;
613 return 0;
614 }
615
616 /*
617 * well, no clone capabilities available - we have to scan
618 * all devices in order to get free one
619 */
620 for (i = 0; i < 1024; i++) {
621 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "/dev/"NSMB_NAME"%d", i);
622 fd = smb_kops.ko_open(buf, O_RDWR, 0);
623 if (fd >= 0) {
624 ctx->ct_fd = fd;
625 return 0;
626 }
627 if (errno == ENOENT)
628 return ENOENT;
629 }
630
631 return ENOENT;
632}
633
634int
635smb_ctx_lookup(struct smb_ctx *ctx, int level, int flags)
636{
637 struct smbioc_lookup rq;
638 int error;
639
640 if ((ctx->ct_flags & SMBCF_RESOLVED) == 0) {
641 smb_error("smb_ctx_lookup() data is not resolved", 0);
642 return EINVAL;
643 }
644 if (ctx->ct_fd != -1) {
645 smb_kops.ko_close(ctx->ct_fd);
646 ctx->ct_fd = -1;
647 }
648 error = smb_ctx_gethandle(ctx);
649 if (error) {
650 smb_error("can't get handle to requester (no /dev/"NSMB_NAME"* device available)", 0);
651 return EINVAL;
652 }
653 bzero(&rq, sizeof(rq));
654 bcopy(&ctx->ct_ssn, &rq.ioc_ssn, sizeof(struct smbioc_ossn));
655 bcopy(&ctx->ct_sh, &rq.ioc_sh, sizeof(struct smbioc_oshare));
656 rq.ioc_flags = flags;
657 rq.ioc_level = level;
658 if (smb_kops.ko_ioctl(ctx->ct_fd, SMBIOC_LOOKUP, &rq) == -1) {
659 error = errno;
660
661 smb_kops.ko_close(ctx->ct_fd);
662 ctx->ct_fd = -1;
663
664 /*
665 * Fallback to *SMBSERVER as NetBIOS name. At least
666 * Windows NT and Windows XP require this (or valid
667 * NetBIOS server name), otherwise they refuse connection.
668 */
669 if (smb_ctx_setserver(ctx, "*SMBSERVER") != 0)
670 goto fail;
671
672 error = smb_ctx_resolve(ctx);
673 if (error)
674 goto fail;
675
676 error = smb_ctx_gethandle(ctx);
677 if (error)
678 goto fail;
679
680 bcopy(&ctx->ct_ssn, &rq.ioc_ssn, sizeof(struct smbioc_ossn));
681
682 if (smb_kops.ko_ioctl(ctx->ct_fd, SMBIOC_LOOKUP, &rq) != -1)
683 goto success;
684 error = errno;
685
686 fail:
687 if (flags & SMBLK_CREATE)
688 smb_error("unable to open connection", error);
689 return error;
690 }
691
692 success:
693 return 0;
694}
695
696int
697smb_ctx_login(struct smb_ctx *ctx)
698{
699 struct smbioc_ossn *ssn = &ctx->ct_ssn;
700 struct smbioc_oshare *sh = &ctx->ct_sh;
701 int error;
702
703 if ((ctx->ct_flags & SMBCF_RESOLVED) == 0) {
704 smb_error("smb_ctx_resolve() should be called first", 0);
705 return EINVAL;
706 }
707 if (ctx->ct_fd != -1) {
708 smb_kops.ko_close(ctx->ct_fd);
709 ctx->ct_fd = -1;
710 }
711 error = smb_ctx_gethandle(ctx);
712 if (error) {
713 smb_error("can't get handle to requester", 0);
714 return EINVAL;
715 }
716 if (smb_kops.ko_ioctl(ctx->ct_fd, SMBIOC_OPENSESSION, ssn) == -1) {
717 error = errno;
718 smb_error("can't open session to server %s", error, ssn->ioc_srvname);
719 return error;
720 }
721 if (sh->ioc_share[0] == 0)
722 return 0;
723 if (smb_kops.ko_ioctl(ctx->ct_fd, SMBIOC_OPENSHARE, sh) == -1) {
724 error = errno;
725 smb_error("can't connect to share //%s/%s", error,
726 ssn->ioc_srvname, sh->ioc_share);
727 return error;
728 }
729 return 0;
730}
731
732int
733smb_ctx_setflags(struct smb_ctx *ctx, int level, int mask, int flags)
734{
735 struct smbioc_flags fl;
736
737 if (ctx->ct_fd == -1)
738 return EINVAL;
739 fl.ioc_level = level;
740 fl.ioc_mask = mask;
741 fl.ioc_flags = flags;
742 if (smb_kops.ko_ioctl(ctx->ct_fd, SMBIOC_SETFLAGS, &fl) == -1)
743 return errno;
744 return 0;
745}
746
747/*
748 * level values:
749 * 0 - default
750 * 1 - server
751 * 2 - server:user
752 * 3 - server:user:share
753 */
754static int
755smb_ctx_readrcsection(struct smb_ctx *ctx, const char *sname, int level)
756{
757 char *p;
758 int error;
759
760 if (level >= 0) {
761 rc_getstringptr(smb_rc, sname, "charsets", &p);
762 if (p) {
763 error = smb_ctx_setcharset(ctx, p);
764 if (error)
765 smb_error("charset specification in the section '%s' ignored", error, sname);
766 }
767 }
768 if (level <= 1) {
769 rc_getint(smb_rc, sname, "timeout", &ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_timeout);
770 rc_getint(smb_rc, sname, "retry_count", &ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_retrycount);
771 }
772 if (level == 1) {
773 rc_getstringptr(smb_rc, sname, "addr", &p);
774 if (p) {
775 error = smb_ctx_setsrvaddr(ctx, p);
776 if (error) {
777 smb_error("invalid address specified in the section %s", 0, sname);
778 return error;
779 }
780 }
781 }
782 if (level >= 2) {
783 rc_getstringptr(smb_rc, sname, "password", &p);
784 if (p)
785 smb_ctx_setpassword(ctx, p);
786 }
787 rc_getstringptr(smb_rc, sname, "workgroup", &p);
788 if (p)
789 smb_ctx_setworkgroup(ctx, p);
790 return 0;
791}
792
793/*
794 * read rc file as follows:
795 * 1. read [default] section
796 * 2. override with [server] section
797 * 3. override with [server:user:share] section
798 * Since abcence of rcfile is not fatal, silently ignore this fact.
799 * smb_rc file should be closed by caller.
800 */
801int
802smb_ctx_readrc(struct smb_ctx *ctx)
803{
804 char sname[SMB_MAXSRVNAMELEN + SMB_MAXUSERNAMELEN + SMB_MAXSHARENAMELEN + 4];
805/* char *p;*/
806
807 if (smb_open_rcfile() != 0)
808 return 0;
809
810 if (ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_user[0] == 0 || ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname[0] == 0)
811 return 0;
812
813 smb_ctx_readrcsection(ctx, "default", 0);
814 nb_ctx_readrcsection(smb_rc, ctx->ct_nb, "default", 0);
815 smb_ctx_readrcsection(ctx, ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname, 1);
816 nb_ctx_readrcsection(smb_rc, ctx->ct_nb, ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname, 1);
817 /*
818 * SERVER:USER parameters
819 */
820 snprintf(sname, sizeof(sname), "%s:%s", ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname,
821 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_user);
822 smb_ctx_readrcsection(ctx, sname, 2);
823
824 if (ctx->ct_sh.ioc_share[0] != 0) {
825 /*
826 * SERVER:USER:SHARE parameters
827 */
828 snprintf(sname, sizeof(sname), "%s:%s:%s", ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_srvname,
829 ctx->ct_ssn.ioc_user, ctx->ct_sh.ioc_share);
830 smb_ctx_readrcsection(ctx, sname, 3);
831 }
832 return 0;
833}
